intro: Amaralia huana, commonly known as the Hawaiian jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy appearance. Amaralia huana is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in well-drained soils.
